item.title: Nicole add a quote by Kami Garcia
item.description: "I'm just the librarian. I can only give you the books. I can't give you the answers." -- Kami Garcia

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Kristin Cashore
item.description: "I'm not going to wear a red dress," she said. "It would look stunning, My Lady," she called. She spoke to the bubbles gathered on the surface of the water. "If there's anyone I wish to stun at dinner, I'll hit him in the face." -- Kristin Cashore

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "It's always easier to say good-bye when you know it's just a prelude to hello." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Walt Disney
item.description: "There is more treasure in books than in all the pirates' loot on Treasure Island and best of all, you can enjoy these riches every day of your life." -- Walt Disney

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Never trust anyone who has not brought a book with them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Pat Conroy
item.description: "You get a little moody sometimes but I think that's because you like to read. People that like to read are always a little fucked up." -- Pat Conroy

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence. <I>Thou shalt not</I> is soon forgotten, but <I>Once upon a time</I> lasts forever." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus
item.description: "When I have a little money, I buy books; and if I have any left, I buy food and clothes." -- Desiderius Erasmus Roterodamus

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Alan Bradley
item.description:
"As I stood outside in Cow Lane, it occurred to me that Heaven must be a place where the library is open twenty-four hours a day, seven days a week.
No ... eight days a week." -- Alan Bradley

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Jesse Andrews
item.description: "Having friends is how your life gets fucked up." -- Jesse Andrews

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Voltaire
item.description: "‎Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats." -- Voltaire

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Susan B. Anthony
item.description: "I distrust those people who know so well what God wants them to do because I notice it always coincides with their own desires." -- Susan B. Anthony

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Books were safer than other people anyway." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Nicole add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "There was a birthday present waiting to be read, a boxed set of the Narnia books, which I took upstairs. I lay on the bed and lost myself in the stories. I liked that. Books were safer than other people anyway." -- Neil Gaiman
